title: TCS, Nasdaq vying for NCDEX equity platform vendor deal
summary: NCDEX is reviewing technical proposals from top global vendors for an equity platform launching in FY27. It has raised  ₹770 crore for financing and aims to entice IPO-bound firms, navigating a competitive landscape dominated by established exchanges.

title: How an Indian CEO ran his first full marathon in a Swedish mine
summary: Hindustan Zinc's CEO Arun Misra ran his first full marathon in October—the world's deepest over a kilometer underground in a Swedish mine. Misra wanted to highlight modern mining practices and shift public perception of the industry and remind customers how integral mining is to everyday life.&nbsp;

summary: Indian stock market: VIX India came close to the 52-week low on Friday before closing at 9.52

summary: Infosys ADR stock price hit 52-week high on Friday, logging an intraday rise of over 56% after the short squeeze trigger

title: Three small-cap aerospace stocks to add to your 2026 watchlist
summary: These small-cap aerospace companies are building strong positions in electronics and precision manufacturing.

title: Who is Dina Powell McCormick? Former Donald Trump advisor leaving Meta board in just eight months
summary: Dina Powell McCormick, a&nbsp;former top adviser to President Donald Trump, has resigned from the Meta Platforms board just eight months after she was brough onboard by Mark Zuckerberg. Sources say she will continue her association in an advisory role.&nbsp;

title: Big win for Elon Musk: Tesla CEO to get 2018 pay package now valued at $140 billion — Will his net worth increase?
summary: Musk's 2018 Tesla pay package is set to be reinstated as the Delaware Supreme Court reversed the ruling of a judge who previously found that the CEO had influenced board members, who came up with the compensation plan, improperly.

title: Elon Musk just got a $138 billion pay day—sort of. What to know.
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has had a year for the ages. He’s up about $200 billion and counting.

title: TCS among ICICI Securities top 5 bets with upside potential of up to 26% in 1 year
summary: ICICI Securities sees Nifty heading towards 29,500 by 2026 and has named Bank of India, Marico, Ultratech Cement, TCS and Sun Pharma as its top five stock picks with upside potential of up to 26% over the next year.

title: Stock market meets physics: 5 laws that explain why prices move the way they do
summary: Ambit Capital has drawn parallels between stock markets and classical physics, outlining five laws that explain price behaviour. From inertia and momentum to mean reversion and valuation resistance, the framework helps investors decode why some stocks outperform while others stagnate, and why rich valuations often cap long-term returns.

title: Wall St ends higher as tech rally continues, led by Micron
summary: U.S. stocks closed higher Friday, with technology shares like Micron and Nvidia leading the rebound after a rocky week. This surge offset declines in consumer stocks such as Nike, which experienced a significant drop. The market also saw optimism around potential Federal Reserve interest rate cuts and the traditional "Santa Claus rally."

title: European shares close at record high driven by defence stocks
summary: European stocks hit a record high Friday, buoyed by defence and insurance sectors, ending the year on an optimistic note. The STOXX 600 index saw significant gains, driven by strong performances in banking and aerospace. This surge follows a week of tech-led losses, with investors now favouring European markets over U.S. tech giants amid falling interest rates.

title: Wall Street Week Ahead: A Santa rally? Investors hope for year-end gains to cap strong 2025
summary: U.S. stocks face year-end turbulence despite solid 2025 performance, with AI spending scrutiny and shifting Fed rate cut expectations driving market swings. While tame inflation data offers some optimism for a Santa Claus rally, investors are also digesting delayed economic reports and considering profit-taking after a strong year.

title: Inox Green to Acquire Macquarie's Renewable Platform Vibrant
summary: Inox Green Energy Services is set to acquire Vibrant Energy, an Indian renewable energy platform. The deal values Vibrant Energy at around $200 million. This acquisition will significantly expand Inox Green's presence in India's growing renewable energy sector. Vibrant Energy manages a substantial renewable portfolio and has a strong client base, including Amazon.

title: Most valued AMC ICICI Pru pips HDFC MF with 20% pop
summary: ICICI Prudential Asset Management made its stock market debut on Friday. The company's shares listed at a significant premium. This listing propelled ICICI Prudential AMC to become the most valuable asset manager in India. Its market capitalization surpassed that of HDFC AMC. Analysts suggest a medium to long-term view for investors who received allotments.

title: Japan's MUFG seals Rs 39,600 crore Shriram Finance Deal
summary: Japan's MUFG Bank will invest ₹39,620 crore for a 20% stake in Shriram Finance. This is India's biggest foreign investment in financial services. The deal will strengthen Shriram Finance's capital and accelerate its growth. MUFG will appoint two directors to Shriram Finance's board. This partnership aims to leverage global expertise with local strength.

title: Piramal Finance to exit Shriram Life Insurance Company
summary: Piramal Finance is selling its 14.72% stake in Shriram Life Insurance to Sanlam Emerging Markets for ₹600 crore. This move aligns with Piramal's strategy to exit non-core assets and reinvest in its lending business. The transaction is expected to close by March 31, 2026, subject to regulatory approvals.

title: Indian Rupee rebounds after hitting country code +91. Will Bank of Japan turn into Santa Claus for INR, stock market
summary: USD vs INR: The Indian Rupee recovered from a record low of 91.07 against the US Dollar, finishing at 89.59 after appreciating by over 1.60% against the record low

title: Gold prices surge 73% YTD to record best gains since 1979: Are they ripe for correction next year?
summary: On the MCX, gold has touched a record high of  ₹135,590 per 10 grams. As of Friday's close, it was trading around the  ₹1,34,200 level, as investor interest in bullion sustained. Meanwhile, since October 2023, it has more than doubled, rising 139%.

title: Nvidia stock unusually cheap at Chip Index, says Bernstein — What it means for investors
summary: Nvidia stock price: Relative to the chip index, Nvidia “currently trades at a ~13% discount, in the first percentile,” wrote analyst Stacy Rasgon.

title: TikTok owner ByteDance on track for $50 billion profit in 2025
summary: ByteDance, parent of video sharing platform TikTok, is on track to earn profit of around $50 billion in 2025. This has been a record year for the Chinese social media leader as it makes major inroads into e-commerce and new markets.

title: Kotak Equities sees Indian stocks faring better in 2026 on 3 factors; adds Dixon, raises IndiGo weight
summary: Kotak Equities expects Indian stocks to perform better in 2026, driven by earnings recovery, improved domestic consumption, and a stable macro backdrop. The brokerage added Dixon Technologies and Aadhar Housing Finance to its model portfolio, raised IndiGo weight, and trimmed Torrent, Airtel, and Reliance, highlighting selective positioning amid pockets of expensive valuations.

title: Infosys ADRs: Here's what company said on unprecedented 40% spike, trading pause
summary: Infosys ADRs surged 40% on the NYSE, hitting a 52-week high of $30 before settling at $20.22, triggering two trading halts. The company clarified that no material events required disclosure. The rally follows Accenture’s strong AI-driven revenue beat, highlighting potential trends for the broader Indian IT sector.

title: 6 multibaggers Vijay Kedia and Mukul Agrawal unearthed in a tough 2025 market
summary: In a challenging 2025, Vijay Kedia and Mukul Agrawal spotted six multibagger stocks, including OSEL Devices and Zelio E-Mobility, that delivered exceptional returns despite a tough market for smallcaps.

title: 11 IPOs opening next week. GMPs hint at up to 57% listing gains
summary: Next week, 11 IPOs, led by Gujarat Kidney and Shyam Dhani Industries, are set to open, with grey market premiums signalling potential listing gains of up to 57%.

title: SBI-owned, FPI's favourite NBFC to be in focus on Monday after this CAPEX update
summary: Paisalo Digital stock price: From 1,052 touchpoints across 18 states in FY23, Paisalo Digital has increased its customer network to 4,380 touchpoints as of Q2 FY26, the company said in a press release on Friday.

title: No need to panic! Chris Wood of Jefferies sees rupee nearing a bottom
summary: Jefferies' Chris Wood suggests that the recent decline of the Indian rupee has been overdone and may signal a bottoming out. With strong foreign reserves and contained current account risks, he believes panic is unwarranted despite the currency’s depreciation against the dollar.

title: Gold, silver set to retain shine, PL Capital paints positive outlook for 2026
summary: Gold, that remained one of the strongest performing assets of 2025, is expected to stay "moderately to strongly positive" in 2026, financial advisory services firm PL Capital has asserted in a report.

title: Momentum investing: short-term dip, long-term edge
summary: Momentum investing may face short-term underperformance, but historical data shows these dips often precede strong long-term gains. Despite recent weakness of around –15%, forward excess returns have historically been robust over 1-, 3-, and 5-year horizons. Discipline and patience remain key for investors seeking long-term trend-driven returns.

title: Explainer: Why Infosys ADRs jumped 40% and why the NYSE halted trading
summary: Infosys ADRs surged 40% on the NYSE, hitting a 52-week high of $30 and triggering two trading halts. Analysts cite a combination of a short squeeze, automated trading glitches, and low holiday liquidity. Infosys clarified there were no material developments behind the sharp spike.

title: 'Markets in consolidation mode; buy on dips, sell on rallies': Kranti Bathini on current market scenario
summary: Kranti Bathini of WealthMills Securities says Indian markets remain in a consolidation phase, with Nifty oscillating between 25,850–26,250. Despite FPI selling and rupee weakness, domestic liquidity supports resilience. Investors are advised to buy on dips and sell on rallies, while sectors like infrastructure, defence, nuclear energy, and semiconductors offer potential opportunities.

title: Concurrent Losers: 13 small-cap stocks decline for 5 consecutive sessions
summary: Thirteen small-cap stocks, including Kothari Industrial and Wardwizard Innovations, recorded losses for five consecutive sessions, with declines ranging from 5% to 23% amid broader market weakness.

title: Reliance shares jump 28% year-to-date; is it time to book profits or buy more?
summary: Reliance shares have surged 28% year-to-date, outperforming the Sensex. Analysts highlight the company's strong fundamentals, including robust earnings growth and strategic investments in digital and retail sectors.&nbsp;

title: Infosys ADRs 40% spike linked to a "bizarre" technical glitch, says report
summary: Infosys ADRs surged as much as 40% on the NYSE before trading was halted twice, despite the company denying any material trigger. A Canada-based report attributed the spike to a bizarre ticker-mapping glitch that may have confused automated trading systems amid thin year-end liquidity.

title: ICICI Prudential AMC, Corona Remedies among 15 IPOs entered Indian stock market last week; 8 trade above issue prices
summary: Last week, 15 companies entered the Indian stock market, showcasing robust investor interest despite volatility. Mainboard IPOs saw strong subscriptions, and an additional 15 companies are expected to join, potentially raising December listings to nearly 50.

title: Current RBI rate cut cycle over; inflation expected to move upwards, says YES Bank
summary: The Consumer Price Index rose to 0.71% in November from 0.25% in October. YES Bank economists predict the MPC will maintain a neutral stance, with no further rate cuts unless growth weakens significantly.&nbsp;

summary: Promoter shareholding in Indian stocks diverged sharply in Q2FY26, with Nazara Technologies seeing a 27.2% increase while Clean Science and Oswal Pumps faced over 24% cuts. Large caps like SBI and Bharti Airtel also experienced significant stake reductions amid mixed market trends.

title: Fortis to acquire Bengaluru-based People Tree Hospital for  ₹430 crore
summary: Fortis Healthcare is set to acquire Bengaluru-based People Tree Hospital for  ₹430 crore. It plans an additional  ₹410 crore investment in the facility over the next three years to augment bed infrastructure, medical equipment and clinical programmes.

title: Sam Altman mum on OpenAI's fundraising plans, future listing, says 0% excited to be a public company CEO
summary: Sam Altman in a podcast did not confirm reports about OpenAI's likely fundraise or future listing plans but said he is 0% excited to be a public company CEO, as it would “in some ways be annoying”.

title: Sebi to form working group on next technological frontier for stock exchanges
summary: India's market regulator Sebi is forming a working group. This group will explore the future of stock exchange technology for the next 5 to 10 years. It will also benchmark global best practices. The aim is to strengthen market infrastructure and investor protection. Sebi is taking a systemic view of technical glitches across exchanges to enhance market technology.

title: GQG Partners’ India Portfolio: 4 stocks soar up to 40% in FY26, others struggle
summary: As of September 2025, the firm held stakes in 12 BSE-listed companies, with the portfolio valued at Rs 66,655 crore—a rise of 11% from Rs 60,221 crore in March 2025.

summary: While gold prices remain on an upward trajectory—posing near-term volume headwinds—we remain constructive on the jewellery sector, underpinned by a sustained structural shift towards organised players, Choice Institutional Equities analysts said.

summary: Gujarat Kidney and Super Speciality IPO: According to the exchange filing, the company has allocated 87,73,120 equity shares at  ₹114 per share to anchor investors.

title: Expert view: A delayed India-US trade deal not an immediate macro shock, says Sonam Srivastava of Wright Research PMS
summary: Expert view on markets: The Indian market faces uncertainty due to a delayed India-US trade deal. Sonam Srivastava of Wright Research PMS believes investors should focus on domestic demand and capital expenditure, while maintaining staggered allocations and avoiding leveraged trades.

title: Is Santa Rally real? Small-cap stocks lead with a perfect 10-year winning streak over mid-caps, large-caps
summary: The Santa Claus Rally indicates that smallcaps consistently outperform during the last five trading days of December and the first two of January, with an average return of 3.55% over the last decade. This seasonal trend remains strong even during market uncertainty.

title: Sebi plans working group to deepen non-farm commodity derivatives market
summary: Sebi is examining whether the regulatory framework governing margins, position limits, and delivery and settlement mechanisms can be optimized without compromising market integrity.

summary: Here's advice Andrej Karpathy, OpenAI co-founder and former director for AI and Autopilot Vision at Tesla, wishes he was told as an undergraduate student.

title: After Elon Musk, Nikhil Kamath's WTF Podcast to feature this billionaire fund manager - Can you guess?
summary: In a post on X on Saturday, Nikhil Kamath dropped a one-minute video teaser of his podcast with Ray Dalio, where they discuss a wide range of topics including crypto, wealth creation, wealth to money ratio and others. The video has already gone viral on social media.

title: Big year for old school Wall Street trades gets lost in AI hype
summary: Even as AI mania dominated headlines in 2025, diversified and multi-asset strategies quietly delivered some of their strongest returns in years. Balanced stock-bond portfolios, global value trades and risk-parity funds outperformed expectations, underscoring the enduring appeal of diversification despite investors continuing to chase concentrated, thematic bets.

title: Gold EGR framework may need a review to revive India’s price-setter ambition: Sebi Chairman
summary: Sebi Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said India’s Electronic Gold Receipts (EGR) framework may need a review as it has not gained the desired traction. He urged greater investor awareness of regulated gold products, stressing that EGRs were meant to help India emerge as a global gold price discovery hub.

title: This ratio deserves a place on your checklist: 5 stocks with an upside potential of up to 36%
summary: Value matters more when the environment gets harder. But value isn’t a low PE number. Value is what you pay relative to what the business can become. That’s why looking beyond PE is not optional; it’s essential. And if you want one simple upgrade to your valuation lens, make it this: Don’t just ask what the stock is trading at. Ask what growth you are paying for.

title: Ola Electric, FirstCry among worst BSE 500 performers, stocks sink up to 62% in 2025
summary: More than 300 BSE 500 stocks ended 2025 in deep losses, with names like Ola Electric, FirstCry and Aditya Birla Fashion plunging as much as 70% amid volatility and sectoral churn.

title: Bitcoin bulls are blinking. 2026 forecasts look soft.
summary: Bitcoin’s slump has prompted Wall Street banks and longtime crypto bulls to dial back longer-term price targets.

title: FIIs dump Rs 1.58 lakh cr in 2025, but Rs 3,000 cr year-end buying sparks 2026 reversal hopes. Here’s why
summary: Foreign Institutional Investors have sold Indian equities worth Rs 14,185 crore in December, contributing to total outflows of Rs 1,57,860 crore in 2025. However, recent buying ahead of the Santa Claus rally has narrowed outflows, sparking hopes for a 2026 reversal. The rupee's depreciation also saw a reversal, aiding the sentiment.

title: Dalal Street Week Ahead: Nifty enters consolidation phase; breakout above 26,100 key for next market move
summary: The Nifty ended the week mildly lower, extending its sideways consolidation within the 25,700–26,100 band amid falling volatility. With no clear breakout and the India VIX near multi-year lows, markets may remain range-bound, making stock-specific and sectoral positioning crucial in the near term.

summary: With gains of 28% in 2025 so far, the Nifty PSU Bank index has emerged as the top-performing sectoral index, largely outperforming the benchmark Nifty 50, which has risen 10% over the same period.

title: Arihant Capital buys over 2 crore shares of this penny stock under  ₹5 — Details here
summary: Arihant Capital buys over 2 crore shares of penny stock under  ₹5, Davangere Sugar, through a bulk deal via the open market on 19 December 2025. The stake purchased fueled up the agro-industrial company's shares by more than 10% during Friday's market session.&nbsp;

title: Not Bitcoin or Ethereum - These 5 are the top best performing cryptos in 2025
summary: Bitcoin is down 7.96% year-to-date, trading at $86,065 as of December 18 after beginning the year at $93,508. In comparison, Ethereum has recorded a steeper decline of 15.25% YTD, with its price falling from $3,337 to $2,828 during the same timeframe.

title: Warren Buffett's currency devaluation warning video resurfaces amid US dollar low, ‘Push towards weaker currencies…’
summary: Warren Buffett's video warning about a currency devaluation in the US economy resurfaced on the social media platform X as the US dollar index hit its 2-month low this week. Here's what the billionaire value investors said in its shareholder meeting earlier this year.&nbsp;

title: Sebi imposes  ₹50 lakh penalty on four individuals over allegations of manipulating GG Engineering shares
summary: The Securities and Exchange Board of India fined four individuals  ₹50 lakh for manipulating shares of G G Engineering Ltd. They created artificial trading volumes and misled investors through false YouTube videos, violating Prohibition of Fraudulent Trade Practices rules, the Sebi order noted.

title: KSH International IPO allotment status out — What GMP signals ahead of share listing date
summary: KSH International IPO shares are set to be listed on the Indian stock market next week on Tuesday, 23 December 2025. Take a look at what the GMP signals on the grey market ahead of the share listing date.&nbsp;

title: It was true in 2008, will be true in 2026, and even in 2036: Hold good stocks for wealth creation; 10 stocks that fit the bill
summary: There is enough evidence to show that it is by holding on to stocks for the long term that you ensure wealth creation. Anything can happen in the short term, but in the long term, stock prices of good companies will surely move up because their earnings are going to be higher. Why will earnings be higher? Because the underlying product or service has a very large runaway of growth and the management has been able to crack the code of growing efficiently under different economic cycles.

title: Gujarat Kidney IPO opens next week — GMP, review, other details in 10 points
summary: Gujarat Kidney IPO: Gujarat Kidney's initial public offering (IPO) is set to open for public subscription next week, starting Monday, 22 December 2025. Here's what the GMP indicates ahead of the public issue open.&nbsp;
